abstract: Maryland Atty Gen Brian E Frosh issues new rules restricting law enforcement officials in state from picking out suspects based on traits including race, ethnicity and sexual orientation; new guidelines prohibiting racial profiling come amid national debate over police treatment of blacks.
lead_paragraph: Eight months after the Justice Department put new curbs on racial profiling, Maryland became the first state to follow suit, restricting the police from singling out suspects based on traits like race.

headline.main: Maryland Restricts Racial Profiling in New Guidelines for Law Enforcement
